title: AMBS #1 Revenge of the Black Warrior
How Far Will You Go - Cycle Against Cancer
Sunny South Criterium
description: The Sunny South Criterium is held at the Sunny South Speedway in Grand Bay, AL.  The track is a wide, fast oval that will test your early season fitness.
course: The course is a completely closed oval, that features slight banking in the turns, and plenty of room for racing action.  There will be a wheel pit close to the start/finish line.  It will be a wheel in/wheel out only, so no neutral support wheels will be provided.
registration: You can pre-register at USA Cycling, or you can send in an entry form by going to www.TeamShareTheRoad.org .  Event entries are listed online, and you can race a second race for $15.
notes: USA Cycling rules apply.  All riders must posess a USA Cycling license.  One-day licenses can be purchased online, or on-site to race Category 5 Men and Category 4 Women for $10.  All riders must sign the standard release waiver before being allowed to race.  Riders will also be required to sign a waiver for Team Share the Road before being issued a race number also.  Registration will close 30 minutes before each event is scheduled to take place.    Helmets should be worn at all times while on a bicycle at this venue.
directions: The track\'s address is: 11380 U.S. 90, Grand Bay, AL 36541.

title: Ironworks Century
course:
Route Distances of 44, 66, 78, & 100
Map, cue sheet, and more event info at BUMP.org
registration: BUMP.org, with link to Ironworks Century
notes:
Ride is part of Alabama Backroads Century Series
Info- www.alabama-Backroads-cycling.com
Medals will be awarded to 100 miler finishers.
directions: Take I-59 from- 30 miles SW of Birmingham, Al- 35 miles NE of Tuscaloosa, Al.. At exit 100 go toward Bucksville and follow the signs to Tannehill Pkwy. Two miles past Bucksville you will lead into Eastern Valley Road, turn right on Eastern Valley Road, then quickly left into Park entrance.

title: Sunny King Criterium
description:
Join 5,000 other race fans lining the race course for the Sunny King Criterium in historic downtown Anniston, Alabama. With the Talladega Superspeedway in our back yard, NASCAR is something we understand. A criterium is like NASCAR -- except it is powered by legs and lungs, not gasoline engines. Hundreds of pros and amateurs race bikes around the .6 mile closed course multiple times -- racing inches apart at speeds reaching 40 mph. And you\'re just inches from the racers as they zoom by on the course. The Red Diamond JumboTron located near the Finish Line ensures that you catch all the action on the course, providing slow motion replays -- which can be especially interesting when there\'s a pileup.

Your afternoon downtown will quickly turn to evening when the Pro Women and Pro Men take the course in back to back races under the streetlights of downtown. More than 12 restaurants are on site providing great food and snacks all day at the 8th Annual Red Diamond Restaurant Tour, selected a Top 10 Event in Alabama in 2012. So plan to eat lunch and dinner at the festival. The Scion KidZone offers more for your kids than they can handle -- art, climbing walls, jump stations, kids bike races and running races, a Talladega Superspeedway pace car, live critter shows, and much more. And you\'ll even see Luke Skywalker and his buddies, Darth Vader, Princess Leah and more Star Wars characters roaming around the festival. If you are a runner, jump in the YMCA 5K hosted early in the morning, and if you enjoy music don\'t miss the Hot Blast Music Cafe. If you are a recreational rider, plan to join us the morning after the festival at the 20th Annual Cheaha Challenge presented by Wells Fargo Advisors---A Gran Fondo! Bring the family and lots of energy and plan to make a weekend of it.
course: Below is a map of the .7 mile course. The races will follow a counter-clockwise direction. The final straight is a slight uphill.
registration:
Registration

Registration for the 2012 Sunny King Criterium is now open at:


On-site Registration will be Available on Race Day inside of Classic on Noble near the Start/Finish line. Race Day registration opens at 9am cst.
notes: Your Entry Fees are Donated to Relay for Life, a local American Cancer Society Fund-raiser. $70,000 has been donated since 2005. 2013 goal is $10,000. Thank you for racing with us!
directions:
Drive times to Anniston:

Birmingham, AL: 1 hour
Atlanta, GA: 1.5 hours
Chattanooga, TN: 2.5 hours
Spartanburg, SC: 4 hours
Montgomery, AL: 2 hours

From Interstate 20: 
From I-20 Exit #185, travel north on AL Hwy 21 approximately 2.5 miles to Anniston. 
When the grassy, tree-lined median becomes visible continue to 10th street and turn left (west). Park in this area and walk one block west to Noble Street. 
From North of Anniston 
Travel South on Hwy 21. 
A grassy, tree-lined median will become visible. Continue to 10th Street and turn right (west) on 10th. 
Park in one of the lots and walk one block west to Noble Street.

title: Foothills Road Race
description: Foothills Road Race is located in Piedmont, AL.
course: Course Description: All races will be held on an out and back course. There is one 6.5 mile section of chip and seal pavement starting at mile 9. Please use your carbon wheels with discretion. The finish is flat. Due to road conditions beyond our control, certain parts of last years course, have been taken out. The new courses will be a bit longer with more climbing. View Mens Pro 1/2 Route. and View Womens Pro 1/2/3 and Amateur Route.
registration: Registration: WE WILL NOT HAVE \"DAY OF\" REGISTRATION FOR THIS RACE. PRE-REGISTERED RIDERS CAN PICK UP BIB NUMBER/SIGN WAIVER SUNDAY MORNING BEFORE THE RACE FROM 7:30 A.M. TO 30 MINUTES PRIOR TO THE START OF THEIR RACE. WE PREFER THAT YOU PICK UP ON SATURDAY AT THE SUNNY KING CRITERIUM IN DOWNTOWN ANNISTON IN CLASSIC ON NOBLE RESTAURANT.
notes: Meals: All riders receive a complimentary breakfast before the race at the Piedmont Civic Center. After the race is over you are invited to come back for your complimentary lunch.
directions:
Directions: For specific directions, we suggest going to mapquest.com and entering the address for the Piedmont Civic Center, which is the Start and Finish of the ride for all route options:

Piedmont Civic Center
500 East McFarland Blvd.
Piedmont, AL 36272

title: Tour de Blue: Cycling for Prostate Cancer Awarenes
description:
The Tour de Blue is a bicycle ride that benefits the Urology Health Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to providing prostate cancer screenings free of charge to men in Alabama who cannot afford the tests.
The ride is presented by Urology Centers of Alabama and Birmingham Bicycle Company.
course: There will be several exciting new cycling routes offered this year, with three ride options (50, 75, and 100 miles). The terrain is rolling with several challenging climbs. The cost of the ride is $50.00 and includes an event t-shirt and lunch provided by Jim \'N Nick\'s Bar-B-Q. There are periodic rest stops on all of the routes that are well stocked with food and drinks. There is full SAG support for all of the riders.
registration: Riders can pre-register at Active.com (http://www.active.com/event_detail.cfm?event_id=2081020). In addition there will be day of registration starting at 6:30am.
directions: The ride leaves from the Red Diamond Corporate Headquarters at 400 Park Ave., Moody, Alabama 35004. Red Diamond is a 106-year-old family-owned coffee, tea, and foodservice company. The corporate office overlooks a gorgeous lake and is located on 65 acres with the Coffee/Tea Manufacturing and Foodservice Distribution Centers.

title: BUMP N' GRIND
course:
Super-D  2.06 miles
Cross Country  Pro/CAT1  31miles
                                  CAT2  19miles
                                  CAT3  8.75 miles
registration:
Early-Bird Registration $35 race entry. Guarantees shirt May 14, 2013 at 11:59 PM 
Pre-registration $45 race entry. Guarantees shirt May 22, 2013 at 11:59 PM 
Online Registration $45 race entry. No guaranteed shirt May 31, 2013 at 11:59 PM 

All riders must sign the USA Cycling waiver on-site to pick up your race packet.
directions: Oak Mountain is just south of Birmingham off I-65 and Hwy. 119. The exit off I-65 is four miles south of the I-65/I-459 interchange. It is exit #246 and is listed as Cahaba Valley Road (also Hwy. 119). This is also the street where most of the hotels are and Cahaba Cycles is 1/2 mile west of I-65 at the intersection of Hwy. 119 with US-31.

title: SCRD Rocket City Omnium
description: Spring City Race Division\'s Rocket City Omnium

title: AL State TT Championship
description: Approximately 23 miles of rolling fun! The money raised will benefit the Columbiana Middle School Special Education Department. I'm looking for donated items to be given out as prizes and raffles. There will be several categories (the usual 1-5) as well as "Eddy Merkx" (no aero gear), mountain bike (must have knobbies) and a place for triathletes!
course: The course is approximately 23 miles long, on rolling terrain.  This not a flat course, but a TT setup is perfectly suitable on this course.  This is an out and back course, so you will have a turnaround to contend with.
registration: You can register online with USA Cycling.  Pre-registration is encouraged, because it allows you to sign the waiver online and just show up to pick up your race number.  If you register on-site, then you have to sign the waiver, and pay a late fee on top of that, so make sure you sign up online.  Online registration closes on August 1st at midnight.  All riders are required to have a annual, or one-day license.
notes: This is the AL State Time Trial Championship, so everyone is racing for state championship medals.
directions:
The start/finish for the race will be at 222 Joinertown Road
Columbiana, AL 35051.  There is plenty of parking, and packet pick-up/registration will be located in front of the school entrance.

title: Crimson Classic
description: University of Alabama Cycling Club is hosting a mountain bike race in Tuscaloosa August 31st and Sept. 1st. We will be putting on collegiate, juniors and open category races.
course: TT is at Sokol Park and it about 5 miles long, flat and technical. Short track course is short and fast with two small inclines. Cross country will be at lake lurleen state park and is approx. 12 miles of challenging rolling hills.
registration: Online registration is through USAC.  Registration on-site will be available as well.
notes: All riders must sign a USA Cycling waiver if they do not pre-register online.  If you agree to the electronic waiver, then this will speed up your packet-pickup process.  USA Cycling Collegiate and MTB rules apply to this event.
directions: google Munny Sokol Park and Lake Lurleen State Park

title: Race for Grace
description: The Race for Grace is criterium in the heart of Decatur, and the new Arts and Entertainment District.  The race proceeds will go to benefit the Refuge of Grace, a non-profit organization that helps women in crisis.  Your registration will help support this organization, and the support they can offer in the area.
course: The course is four corners with wide roads and a slightly downhill sprint.  A map of the race course can be found here: http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/234545295 .  The course will actually run in the reverse direction that you see on the map, so it will be all right hand turns.
registration:
Online registration will be available through Thursday, September 5th.  Online registration prices will increase on Monday, September 2nd, so you can save money by registering before that date.  The registration will close at 11:59 PM CST that night.  You can also mail your registration in by sending cash, or check, and a note with your license # and races you want to enter to:  Stuart Lamp, 2002 16th Avenue SE, Decatur, AL 35601

On-site registration, and packet pick-up will begin 1 hour before the start of the first race.  There will be a $5 day-of registration penalty over the pre-registration fee at the close of online registration, so please make sure you pre-register.  Registration for each event will close no later than 15 minutes before the start of the event.

Riders will have the opportunity to race in multiple events, and we are going to offer any additional registrations for only $10 per race.
notes:
The wheel pit will be located near the start/finish line, and will be a wheel in/wheel-out pit.  There will be a local mechanic working the pit, and will provide as much support as possible for racers.

The free lap rule will be in effect, and will end at 8 KM to go.  This will be the equivalent of 7 laps to go on this course.

The prize purse listed does not include the primes on offer.  Free entries for the Southeast Regional Series: Greenville, SC. , Pensacola Cycling Classic, and prizes/gift cards will offered in races all day.
directions: Parking will be available all around the race course, but the main parking areas can be reached by taking Lee Street, Moulton St, or Johnston St. off of Hwy. 31 in Decatur.

title: AL State RR Championship
description: The 2013 AL State RR Championship will be on September 8th in Sommerville, AL.
course: The course is approximately a 16.2 mile loop.  The course features one categorized climb, but the climb comes in the first 3 miles of the lap with a 4% average grade.  After this, the course is rolling with a very flat, and fast finish that ends just a quarter of a mile off of the loop.  You can find all the course details here: http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/234571149.
registration:
Online registration will be available through Thursday, September 5th. Online registration prices will increase on Monday, September 2nd, so you can save money by registering before that date. The registration will close at 11:59 PM CST that night. You can also mail your registration in by sending cash, or check, and a note with your license # and races you want to enter to: Stuart Lamp, 2002 16th Avenue SE, Decatur, AL 35601.

On-site registration will be available at the Race for Grace Crit, as well as the road race venue 1 hour before the start of the first race. There will be a $5 day-of registration penalty over the pre-registration fee at the close of online registration, so please make sure you pre-register. Registration for each event will close no later than 15 minutes before the start of the event. If you have the potential to race in an additional race, then the additional registration is only $15 per race.
notes:
The race will have wheel truck support, so wheel in/wheel out will be available.  The wheel trucks will be parked at the parking area, and should be loaded 10 minutes prior to race start.  

The feed zone will be located at the top of the climb, and the start and finish of the zone will be clearly marked.  You can park on West Point Loop, at the intersection of West Point Rd. and West Point Loop.  The feed zone will start just past the intersection on West Point Rd.

Results will be posted at the parking area, and we will have them available as soon as possible after each race.  We will do  a podium ceremony once the protest period is complete for each race. 

Race director reserves the right to combine fields if field minimums are not met for each group.
directions: Parking is located at 61 Florette Park Rd., Somerville, AL 35670.  If the parking lot fills up, then additional parking can be found on the other side of Hwy. 67 at A.P. Brewer High School.

title: Ivan Leonard Chevrolet Team Magic CX
Momentum CX Fueled By Mugshots
description: September 29th 2013 CX Race at Jeff State
course: Course located at athletic complex on North side of Carson Rd Jeff State campus. 1.7 mile lap including trail, tarmac, and grass surfaces. Course includes barriers, run up, and stairs
notes:
- Compete in 2nd race and pay only $10 for each subsequent race  day of registration ONLY!

-You may register until 30 minutes before the start of each race

-Race will be held rain-or-shine | No refunds

-All USA Cycling Rules Apply

-No glass containers and no parking on grass

-Playground and Bounce Tent for kids

-Food available for purchase
directions: -From I-20/59 take exit 128 (Tallapoosa St) and head North on AL-79 for 10 miles. Turn right onto Jefferson State Pkwy. Go .2 miles and park in lot on right.

title: Grand River Super Speedway Cross Race
Metro Bank Team Magic CX Pell City
Anniston CX 'Night Race'
course: Fast, flowing, and technical. Includes the famous "Woodland Park Sandpit"
registration: $25 pre register. $35 day of race. Each additional race is $10.
notes: This will be the last event held at Woodland Park under the ownership of the City of Anniston. Let's go out in style.

title: Team Magic CX Irondale
description:
TEAM MAGIC CX IRONDALE - DECEMBER 29, 2013
Visit for More Details: team-magic.com facebook.com/teammagicmultisport facebook.com/teammagiccx
$3000 Series Cash Purse, $1000 Coca-Cola Club Challenge, $10,000 Series Finale Prize Raffle benefitting
http://www.littlebitsrescue.org
registration:
REGISTRATION INFO:
 Registration closes on Thursday midnight before each race. 1 free pair of Stuffitts to all who register online
 Race Day registration for CX Bike start at 8:00 am
 Race Day registration for XC Runs starts at 2:00 pm
 You may register until 30 minutes before the start of each race
 Compete in second race or third race and pay only $10 per race for each subsequent race
 NEW OPTION - RELAY TEAMS - one lap per rider, $5 per person per race - prizes 3 deep!

 About Time providing chip timing

Products
 Award Sponsors: Advocare, Bike Link, Cahaba Cycles, Hammer Nutrition, ProGold, Rammer Jammer Beer,
Red Bike Coffee, Road ID, Shave Secret, Stuffitts, Trak Shak & TEAM MAGIC CX logo prize!
 Youth racers receive free meal and finisher item. Discount if they do run & bike race
notes:
Youth racers receive free meal and finisher item. Discount if they do run & bike race
 Race held rain or shine
 All USAC for bike & RRCA for run rules apply
 Portion of race proceeds and all proceeds from the ~ $10,000 series finale GRAND PRIZES raffle go
to www.littlebitsrescue.org Be sure and buy extra tickets from Little Bits. Check out Team Magic CX
Facebook or www.team-magic.com Info on all the great prizes for the raffle. You do not want to miss!
 Sponsors: City of Irondale, Pucker Powder, Bike Link, Cahaba
